item.title: Singapore Airlines, Scoot, and Jetstar provide guidance on booking and canceling flights to Thailand
item.description:
Sign at the Singapore Airlines counter in Changi Airport Singapore Airlines is currently running its flights to and from Bangkok as originally planned. However, they are suggesting that passengers get ready for potential traffic delays in the city, which could be caused by street closures or heightened security measures. “We recommend that customers arrange to arrive at the airport no less than four hours before their flight and, if possible, utilize the airport train,” stated the airline’s website announcement on May 23rd...
